snippet: The Rev. Al Sharpton was in prime form, whipping off the kind of politically potent one-liners that have come to define his campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination. The crowd was smiling, clapping, people jumping to their feet. It seemed...

headline: Kucinich's Campaign Leaves Hometown Voters Wondering
snippet: On the presidential campaign trail, Representative Dennis J. Kucinich boasts that he is ''Cleveland's favorite son.'' But some who live in his district wonder whether this son has distanced himself too much from the hometown voters who have sent him...

headline: National Briefing | Washington: New Head For Federal Agency
snippet: A senior official with the Secret Service was named to lead the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives. The new director, Carl J. Truscott, had been an assistant director at the Secret Service in charge of threat assessment and other...

headline: Airlines Gave F.B.I. Millions of Records on Travelers After 9/11
snippet: In the days after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks in 2001, the nation's largest airlines, including American, United and Northwest, turned over millions of passenger records to the Federal Bureau of Investigation, airline and law enforcement officials...

headline: NASA Weighs Robot Mission To Maintain Telescope
snippet: Four and a half months after he seemed to doom the Hubble Space Telescope by ending maintenance missions by the space shuttle, NASA's administrator, Sean O'Keefe, brought brighter news to astronomers on Tuesday by announcing that NASA was seeking...

headline: Sundae News
snippet: In this lesson, students research topics related to ice cream and create a news magazine program based on their research. Then students develop public service announcements promoting ice cream consumption.

headline: Black Farmers' Refrain: Where's All Our Money?
snippet: R.L. Stevenson was bundled into a recliner, a bowl of prescription medicine bottles at his elbow. At 79, he can no longer work his farm here in Oktibbeha County, about 150 miles northeast of Jackson, though until he fell ill a year ago he baled hay...

headline: The Latin Grammys Present A Variety of Musical Styles
snippet: For a show aiming to encompass the breadth of Latin music, from Cuban to Brazilian, the Latin Grammys still rely heavily on non-Latin star power to draw television viewers.

headline: Disarray Thwarts Terrorist List, Inquiry Finds
snippet: Efforts to create a master terrorist watch list" are lagging badly because of a lack of leadership at the Department of Homeland Security and other bureaucratic problems."

headline: Once-Bitten Networks Vow Not to Make Hasty Calls
snippet: With memories of botched calls in the 2000 presidential race, the news networks say they are under increased pressure to get it right when they declare a winner.

headline: Legislators Move to Toughen Federal Rail Oversight
snippet: Two senators, a Republican and a Democrat, joined Tuesday to introduce legislation to toughen federal oversight of the rail industry.

headline: Eyeing the Next Einstein
snippet: In this lesson, students learn about the iconic status of Albert Einstein. They create trading cards about famous scientists and write a job description seeking a potential heir to the Einstein legacy.

headline: On the Day After, Attending to the Details of Death
snippet: For all the division surrounding the end of Terri Schiavo's life, the day after she died was defined, in part, by the practical realities of death.

headline: Fresh Outrage in Waco at Grisly Lynching of 1916
snippet: A movement is growing to commemorate the lynching of Jesse Washington, a 17-year-old black farmhand railroaded to a conviction in the murder and rape of a white woman.

headline: Planned Parenthood Is Told To Show Children's Files
snippet: Planned Parenthood of Indiana has to show state investigators the medical records of some of its youngest patients, a judge ruled on Tuesday.

headline: In List of Potential Justices, Many Kinds of Conservative
snippet: While all of the candidates may be described as conservative, each brings a different political and philosophical profile to the table.

headline: Atkins, the Diet Company, Seeks Protection From Its Creditors
snippet: Atkins Nutritionals, which started the low-carbohydrate diet craze, filed for protection from its creditors. The company's fortunes have waned along with the popularity of the diet.

headline: Terrorist Known Before 9/11, More Say
snippet: A Defense Department inquiry has found three more people who recall seeing an intelligence briefing slide that identified the ringleader of the Sept. 11 attacks a year before the hijackings and terrorist strikes, Pentagon and military officials said...

headline: Long Hard Slog Brings Yankees Back to the Top
snippet: Three months ago, they were a .500 team. But after getting the final out on Saturday, the Yankees were A.L. East champions for the eighth straight season.

headline: In One Day, Fire Lays Waste To a Piece of Bottled History
snippet: A fire in Vallejo, Calif., in a wine storage warehouse destroyed $100 million worth of wine. The fire, later declared an arson, affected nearly 100 wineries.
